mapPackage

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • mapPackage.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

    Map Class

    The Map class contains the data of a specific 2D character map and the methods to initialize, and update the characters of the map. It also contains a method for input validation.
    Since:
    2018-10-18
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Brandon Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map(int maxRows, int maxColumns, char base)
      If maxRows and maxColumns are integers greater than 0, assign their values to the current instance's maxRows and maxColumns, then construct a 2D character matrix of dimensions maxRows and maxColumns.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxDimension(java.lang.String dimension)
      Let other classes access the maxRows and maxColumns values for any given dimension given as a String (Row, Column).
      boolean isValidCoordinate(int input, java.lang.String dimension)
      Validate whether or not a given integer input exists within the range of valid coordinates for any given dimension given as a String (Row, Column).
      static boolean isValidInitialize(int input)
      Validate whether or not a given int is strictly greater than 0.
      boolean isValidMap()
      Validate whether or not 2D character matrix has been initialized with the correct number of rows and columns.
      void printMap()
      Display the 2D character matrix to standard out.
      Note: Public modifier so that the map might be printed from MapMain.
      boolean updateMap(int row, int column, char character)
      Change the character at a given index.
      Note: Public modifier so that the map might be updated using values inputed through MapMain, and actual indeces are 1 smaller than the requested input format.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int maxRows,
           int maxColumns,
           char base)
        If maxRows and maxColumns are integers greater than 0, assign their values to the current instance's maxRows and maxColumns, then construct a 2D character matrix of dimensions maxRows and maxColumns. Initialize every element in the matrix to the inputed base char. Print error messages if any of these steps fail.
        Parameters:
        maxRows - int:
        Number of rows the map will contain.
        maxColumns - int:
        Number of columns the map will contain.
        base - character:
        Initial state of the map.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidInitialize

        public static boolean isValidInitialize(int input)
        Validate whether or not a given int is strictly greater than 0.
        Note: Public modifier so that validation can be done immediately when inputed by user in MapMain.
        Parameters:
        input - int:
        Input to validate.
        Returns:
        boolean:
        true - condition is met
        false - condition has not been met.

      • isValidMap

        public boolean isValidMap()
        Validate whether or not 2D character matrix has been initialized with the correct number of rows and columns.
        Note: Public modifier so that if validation fails in MapMain, the program may be terminated.
        Returns:
        boolean:
        true - 2D character matrix has been initialized with the correct number of rows and columns.
        false - 2D character matrix has not been initialized with the correct number of rows and columns.

      • isValidCoordinate

        public boolean isValidCoordinate(int input,
                                 java.lang.String dimension)
        Validate whether or not a given integer input exists within the range of valid coordinates for any given dimension given as a String (Row, Column).
        Note: Public modifier so that if validation fails in MapMain, the program may ask for another integer.
        Parameters:
        input - int:
        Index to validate.
        dimension - String:
        "Row" - Check if input is a valid index for the rows.
        "Column" - Check if input is a valid index for the columns.
        Returns:
        boolean:
        true - input is a valid index
        false - dimension is not a recognized input.
        false - input is an invalid index.

      • getMaxDimension

        public int getMaxDimension(java.lang.String dimension)
        Let other classes access the maxRows and maxColumns values for any given dimension given as a String (Row, Column). Arguments: String dimension.
        Note: Getter method.
        Parameters:
        dimension - String:
        "Row" - Request the number of rows.
        "Column" - Request the number of columns.
        Returns:
        int:
        maxRows - dimension is "Row".
        maxColumns - dimension is "Column".
        -1 - dimension is neither "Row" nor "Column".

      • updateMap

        public boolean updateMap(int row,
                         int column,
                         char character)
        Change the character at a given index.
        Note: Public modifier so that the map might be updated using values inputed through MapMain, and actual indeces are 1 smaller than the requested input format.
        Parameters:
        row - int:
        Row index.
        column - int:
        Column index.
        character - char:
        Character to insert and given coordinate.
        Returns:
        boolean:
        true - map coordinate was successfully overwritten with the inputed character.
        false - map was unsuccessfully updated.

      • printMap

        public void printMap()
        Display the 2D character matrix to standard out.
        Note: Public modifier so that the map might be printed from MapMain.
